page.title: 03GLENDEVON CHICKEN FARM
page.content: This farm is owned by D.B.Marshall (Breeders) of Newbridge, Midlothian, and is one of their 13 chicken breeding farms. From the outside all one can see are 4 huge wooden buildings, but these are split into three parts on the inside, with a central section for the feed machinery and the ends being used to house the chickens. The staff of only 2 look after about 6,400 female birds in each of 7 of these sections, and 5,500 males in the 8th. Day old chicks come here from Newbridge, and are fed on a crumbed wheat and barley mix each morning, leaving the farm when 20 weeks old to go to another farm in the group. The all white chickens are all very clean and well cared for, being regularly checked for symptoms of disease or other problems.
